integrations_researched.name: react-signature-canvas
integrations_researched.purpose: Digital signature capture for inspection sign-off

key_functions: isEmpty() - returns boolean to check if signature exists
toDataURL(mimetype, encoderOptions) - returns signature as base64 data URL
fromDataURL(base64String, options) - loads signature from base64
getTrimmedCanvas() - returns canvas with whitespace removed

required_props: ref - React ref to access API methods
optional_props: canvasProps - object passed to canvas element

integration_notes.material_ui_compatibility: Works with MUI, example integration available in GitHub Gist
integration_notes.mobile_optimization: Works on touch devices, use canvasProps for responsive sizing

gotchas: Canvas resize causes de-sync when clearOnResize=false - known issue #47
Changing width/height via CSS zooms canvas incorrectly - use props instead
For responsive layouts, consider omitting width/height to auto-resize on window change
Repeated save/load on resize degrades image quality - avoid redrawOnResize in production
All API methods require a ref to access (instance methods, not component props)
Must use ref pattern: const sigCanvas = useRef(null); <SignatureCanvas ref={sigCanvas} />

integrations_researched.name: react-camera-pro
integrations_researched.purpose: Mobile-first camera component for photo capture in inspection checklist

key_functions: takePhoto() - returns base64-encoded JPEG image string
switchCamera() - toggles between front/back camera, returns new facing mode
getNumberOfCameras() - returns count of available cameras

required_props: ref - React ref to access camera methods
optional_props: numberOfCamerasCallback - function called when camera count changes

infrastructure.https_note: WebRTC requires secure connections (HTTPS), except localhost for testing
infrastructure.browser_support: Tested on iOS and Android mobile browsers
infrastructure.desktop_support: Works with standard webcams on desktop

integration_notes.camera_switching: Built-in support for front/back camera switching on mobile

gotchas: MUST use HTTPS in production - WebRTC will not work on HTTP (except localhost)
Camera permissions must be granted by user - handle permission denial gracefully
takePhoto() returns base64 string directly - may need conversion for upload
Mobile browsers may have different camera access behaviors across iOS/Android
No built-in error handling - wrap in try/catch for permission/access errors

integrations_researched.name: react-webcam
integrations_researched.purpose: Alternative camera component for photo/video capture (more established)

key_functions: getScreenshot() - captures current frame as base64-encoded string
supports video recording via MediaStream Recording API

required_props: ref - React ref to access webcam methods
optional_props: facingMode - 'user' for front camera, 'environment' for back camera

integration_notes.maturity: Very established library with 1.3k GitHub stars
integration_notes.use_case: Good alternative to react-camera-pro, more downloads and community support

gotchas: getScreenshot() must be called via ref, not as a prop
Default screenshot format is WebP - may want JPEG for broader compatibility
Video constraints must match device capabilities or camera won't initialize
Mobile camera access requires user permission - handle denial gracefully

integrations_researched.name: react-dropzone
integrations_researched.purpose: File upload with mobile camera capture support (already installed in project)

key_functions: useDropzone() - hook that returns props for dropzone area and input

mobile_camera_props.capture: 'camera' or 'environment' - can force camera capture on mobile

optional_props: accept - MIME types object to filter file types
maxSize - max file size in bytes
onDrop - callback when files are dropped/selected

integration_notes.mobile_behavior: On mobile devices, clicking browse shows menu with gallery, file system, and camera options
integration_notes.camera_trigger: When accept specifies image types, 'Take Photo' option appears and opens camera
integration_notes.existing_usage: Project already uses react-dropzone v14.2.3 - can extend for camera capture

gotchas: MIME type determination not reliable across platforms (macOS vs Windows differences)
Issue #945: Memory errors reported when attaching images directly from phone camera on some devices
Camera capture attribute behavior varies between iOS and Android
Accept prop with specific image types may trigger unwanted camera on some devices (Issue #1084)
For camera-first experience, consider react-camera-pro or react-webcam instead

integrations_researched.name: Material UI (MUI)
integrations_researched.purpose: UI component library already used in project for consistent design

imports: import { Button, Box, Card, Typography } from '@mui/material'
key_components_for_checklist: Button - for photo capture, signature trigger, submit

configuration.theme_integration: Project likely has existing MUI theme - maintain consistency
configuration.responsive_props: Use sx prop for responsive styling, breakpoints for mobile optimization

integration_notes.file_upload_pattern: MUI doesn't have native camera component - integrate with react-camera-pro or react-webcam
integration_notes.signature_integration: MUI Dialog can wrap SignatureCanvas for modal experience
integration_notes.mobile_optimization: Use MUI's responsive breakpoints and mobile-first sx props

gotchas: MUI components are div-based - canvas elements need proper sizing within MUI containers
Dialog fullScreen prop recommended for mobile signature/camera capture
MUI theme spacing may conflict with canvas element sizing - test thoroughly

recommendations: Use react-signature-canvas for signature capture - most mature, TypeScript support, 100% test coverage
Choose react-camera-pro for mobile-first camera experience OR react-webcam for more established library (113k downloads)
Leverage existing react-dropzone for alternative photo upload from gallery
Use MUI Dialog with fullScreen prop for mobile signature and camera capture modals
Ensure HTTPS deployment for camera features (WebRTC requirement)
Store signatures and photos as base64 or convert to Blob for backend upload
Consider photo compression before upload to reduce mobile data usage
Test camera permission handling across iOS Safari and Android Chrome
Use MUI Card components for checklist sections to maintain design consistency
Implement responsive canvas sizing using canvasProps rather than CSS for signature pad

critical_infrastructure_requirements.https_mandatory: Camera capture (WebRTC) requires HTTPS in production
critical_infrastructure_requirements.browser_permissions: Must handle camera permission requests/denials gracefully
critical_infrastructure_requirements.mobile_testing: Test on actual iOS and Android devices, not just desktop browsers
critical_infrastructure_requirements.storage_consideration: Base64 images are large - consider compression or blob conversion
